meanings.definition: To introduce gradually or impart (a quality or idea)
meanings.sent1: She instilled kindness in her students through small acts of generosity.
meanings.sent2: Her parents instilled good manners in her from a young age.
meanings.sent3: The teacher instilled the importance of teamwork by organizing fun group activities.
meanings.sent4: His words instilled hope in the hearts of the weary travelers.
meanings.sent5: The wise old owl instilled wisdom in the young owlets with his stories.

meanings.definition: To infuse or implant by repeated or persistent effort
meanings.sent1: The coach instilled discipline in the team by setting strict rules.
meanings.sent2: She instilled a love for reading in her children by reading bedtime stories every night.
meanings.sent3: The magician instilled a sense of wonder in the audience with his mesmerizing tricks.
meanings.sent4: The artist instilled emotion into his paintings, making them come alive.
meanings.sent5: The gardener instilled beauty in the garden by carefully tending to each flower.

meanings.definition: To cause to enter drop by drop
meanings.sent1: She instilled the medicine into the patient's IV slowly to avoid any reactions.
meanings.sent2: The chef instilled flavor into the dish by adding the secret sauce drop by drop.
meanings.sent3: The scientist instilled the chemical into the solution with precise measurements.
meanings.sent4: The rain instilled life into the dry earth, quenching its thirst drop by drop.
meanings.sent5: The artist instilled color into the canvas, creating a masterpiece with each brushstroke.
